apiOperation.shortdesc: once TileGrid is done with a tile, it will call destroy and possibly reuse it later

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: once TileGrid is done with a tile, it will call destroy and possibly reuse it later

apiOperation.shortdesc: override this in a subclass and call grid.setTileClass if you want to draw on your tiles

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: override this in a subclass and call grid.setTileClass if you want to draw on your tiles

apiOperation.shortdesc: this may seem like a heavy function, but it only gets called once per render and it doesn't have any loops, so it flies by, really

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: this may seem like a heavy function, but it only gets called once per render and it doesn't have any loops, so it flies by, really

apiOperation.shortdesc: called inside of onRender before events are fired enforceBoundsOnMatrix modifies worldMatrix directly doesn't use scale/zoomLevel setters to correct values otherwise we'd get stuck in a loop!

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: called inside of onRender before events are fired enforceBoundsOnMatrix modifies worldMatrix directly doesn't use scale/zoomLevel setters to correct values otherwise we'd get stuck in a loop!

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the Tile instance that corresponds to a given coordinate.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the Tile instance that corresponds to a given coordinate.

apiOperation.shortdesc: returns an array of all the tiles that are on the screen (including parent and child tiles currently visible until the current zoom level finishes loading)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: returns an array of all the tiles that are on the screen (including parent and child tiles currently visible until the current zoom level finishes loading)

apiOperation.shortdesc: processes the tileQueue and optionally outputs stats into debugField

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: processes the tileQueue and optionally outputs stats into debugField

apiOperation.shortdesc: figures out from worldMatrix which tiles we should be showing, adds them to the stage, adds them to the tileQueue if needed, etc.
The classes themselves serve as factories!

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The classes themselves serve as factories!

apiValue.shortdesc: set this to true to enable enforcing of map bounds from the map provider's limits

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: set this to true to enable enforcing of map bounds from the map provider's limits

apiValue.shortdesc: if we don't have a tile at currentZoom, onRender will look for tiles up to one levels further in.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: if we don't have a tile at currentZoom, onRender will look for tiles up to one levels further in. set this to 0 if you only want the current zoom level's tiles WARNING: bad, bad nasty recursion possibilities really soon if you go much above 1 - it works, but you probably don't want to change this number :)

apiValue.shortdesc: if maxParentSearch is enabled, setting maxParentLoad to between 1 and maxParentSearch will make requests for lower zoom levels first

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: if maxParentSearch is enabled, setting maxParentLoad to between 1 and maxParentSearch will make requests for lower zoom levels first

apiValue.shortdesc: if we don't have a tile at currentZoom, onRender will look for tiles up to 5 levels out.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: if we don't have a tile at currentZoom, onRender will look for tiles up to 5 levels out. set this to 0 if you only want the current zoom level's tiles WARNING: tiles will get scaled up A LOT for this, but maybe it beats blank tiles?

apiValue.shortdesc: this is the maximum size of tileCache (visible tiles will also be kept in the cache)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: this is the maximum size of tileCache (visible tiles will also be kept in the cache)

apiValue.shortdesc: set this to false, along with roundScalesEnabled, if you need a map to stay 'fixed' in place as it changes size

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: set this to false, along with roundScalesEnabled, if you need a map to stay 'fixed' in place as it changes size

apiValue.shortdesc: set this to false, along with roundPositionsEnabled, if you need a map to stay 'fixed' in place as it changes size

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: set this to false, along with roundPositionsEnabled, if you need a map to stay 'fixed' in place as it changes size

apiValue.shortdesc: read-only, this is the level of tiles we'll be loading first

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: read-only, this is the level of tiles we'll be loading first

apiValue.shortdesc: derived from map provider by calculateBounds(), read-only here for convenience

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: derived from map provider by calculateBounds(), read-only here for convenience

apiValue.shortdesc: derived from map provider by calculateBounds(), read-only here for convenience

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: derived from map provider by calculateBounds(), read-only here for convenience

apiOperation.shortdesc: Return a new coordinate that corresponds to that of the tile containing this one

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Return a new coordinate that corresponds to that of the tile containing this one

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns true if the the two coordinates refer to the same Tile location.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns true if the the two coordinates refer to the same Tile location.

apiOperation.shortdesc: enlarges this extent so that the given extent is inside it

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: enlarges this extent so that the given extent is inside it

apiOperation.shortdesc: enlarges this extent so that the given location is inside it

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: enlarges this extent so that the given location is inside it

apiOperation.shortdesc: calculate the north/south/east/west extremes of the given array of locations

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: calculate the north/south/east/west extremes of the given array of locations

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates a new MapExtent from the given String.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new MapExtent from the given string

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates a new MapExtent from the given String.
